channel.title: Error, need assistance! (SOLVED)
channel.description:
Hello moparscape people, I have an error after trying to follow a tutorial on adding Lodestone teleports for project insanity, example of this would be: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=587886.20. I got this error after following ALL of the tutorial in my compiler:
[code]source\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:4: package sever.conten t does not exist import sever.content.Lodestone; ^ source\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:76: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Lodestone location: class server.model.players.packets.ClickingButtons if (Lodestone.getButtonID() == actionButtonId) { ^ source\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:78: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Lodestone location: class server.model.players.packets.ClickingButtons c.getPA().startTeleport(Lodestone.getX(), Lodestone.getY(), 0, "modern"); ^ source\server\model\players\packets\ClickingButtons.java:78: cannot find symbol symbol : variable Lodestone location: class server.model.players.packets.ClickingButtons c.getPA().startTeleport(Lodestone.getX(), Lodestone.getY(), 0, "modern"); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 4 errors[/code]
It's telling me server.content.Lodestone; don't exist correct? Thing is.. I have it in there and here's the screenshot of where I have it.
http://i42.tinypic.com/wuosd3.png
Please help me, as-for it would be MUCH appreciated as this is giving me a headache trying to fix on my own xD.
Kind regards, Skiller8860

item.title: Error, need assistance! (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @mrnessie mrnessie
item.description:
@mrnessie wrote:

.java is a class… The file is called a class hence the “public class Lodestones” at the begijnning

Read full topic

item.title: Error, need assistance! (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @skiller8860 skiller8860
item.description:
@skiller8860 wrote:

LodeStone class? It doesn’t even create the .class file. It just has the .java file. It’s not even compiling the Lodestone.java and processing it through as a .class file. The compiler is just having those issues… Would it help if I tried editing the file in an IDE? By packaging, do you mean the package server.content? Cause it says that don’t exist, but look at the screenshot that I posted… It’s in server.content …? Right?

Read full topic

item.title: Error, need assistance! (SOLVED)
item.dc:creator: @mrnessie mrnessie
item.description:
@mrnessie wrote:

Import lodestone class and packaging is wrong

Read full topic
